text: my name is carlos saldanha I'm the
director of the movie Rio I'm originally
from Rio I'm a Carioca as they say back
to home I've been living in the US for
20 years and since I came here and I
start making movies I always thought
that would be a good idea to make a
movie using Rio as a backdrop I I
thought the city was always very
photogenic it's a have like great angles
and different locations that always I
thought was very interesting for a movie
especially animation there where the
colors are the elements of it could be
you know much more vibrant and much more
exciting so and I like the contrast of
the city i think what attract me for an
REO is the fact that you have the
mountains near the ocean you have like
the concrete jungle with a real jungle
next to it Rio is an animated movie so
but I wanted people to feel like they
are in Rio it's it's very difficult to
make it feel realistic because its
animation and also we have constraints
like budgetary constraints time
constraints and it's a city very complex
with different elements so what I wanted
to make sure that we capture the main
parts of the city like the things that
in the city that will end marks that
we're very noticeable and people will be
able to understand where we are so you
know we took a few creative liberties
but in general if you look at the city
at a glance you know when you watch the
movie it feels like you're there it's
very close to the reality not exactly
like the reality but very close so I try
to at least like for example the shape
of the mountains the silhouette of the
city I tried to make sure that it felt
right
